result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea M Beaudry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrea M Beaudry is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrea M Beaudry was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: w/Huber.  Stayed for one year to complete 64 hours of community service, on her own. She must provide the court with verification within a year.
$67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

9:23 AM Defendant Andrea M Beaudry in court.  Attorney Colleen J. Martine in court for Andrea M Beaudry.  Attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 


On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count 1 . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 2      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve  8 days  in the DCJ, with Huber 
-Stayed for one year to complete 64 hours of community service, on her own. She must provide the court with verification within a year. 
-DNA on file

-Days credit for time served:  0 days
-Days credit to jail: 0 days


COURT COSTS:
Ct 2
-All CC, DNA surcharge waived. VW surcharge due in 60 days



-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at Spring Hill Suites on Frey St in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 13 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

10:42 AM Defendant appeared.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:45 am.
